DiscussionSteps.Details: Clearly articulate the purpose of the discussion to guide the conversation and maintain focus.
Select experts with the necessary knowledge and expertise to contribute meaningfully to the discussion.
Prepare a clear agenda to structure the conversation and cover all relevant topics.
Set rules for respectful and productive communication, such as speaking in turns and respecting others' opinions.
Lead the discussion by asking questions, encouraging participation, and ensuring everyone has the opportunity to speak.
Monitor the time to cover all agenda topics and keep the discussion on schedule.
Promote attentive listening among participants, which includes not interrupting and asking clarifying questions.
Address and mediate any disputes or misunderstandings that arise to maintain a constructive environment.
At the end of the discussion, recap the main points and decisions to ensure a shared understanding.
After the discussion, take necessary actions such as distributing a summary, scheduling further meetings, or assigning tasks.
